<h3 id="october-2019">October 2019</h3>

<h3 id="september-2019">September 2019</h3>
<p>
  For the complete CHANGELOG,{' '}
  <a href="https://gitlab.com/university-of-missouri/mizzou-digital/miz-ds/mizzou-design-system/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md">
    see the repository on Gitlab
  </a>
  .
</p>

<h4 id="new-updated-components">New/updated components</h4>
<ul>
  <li>
    <strong>Buttons.</strong> To support the branded versions, buttons are now organized into Base,
    Primary and Secondary. Primary and Secondary buttons now have <code>default</code>,{' '}
    <code>light</code> and <code>ghost</code> variants.
    <ul>
      <li>
        The original <code>--ghost-gold</code> and <code>--ghost</code> classes have not been
        changed but should now be considered variants of <code>primary</code> and{' '}
        <code>secondary</code> buttons, respectively. In a future update, the styles will be
        refactored to require a proper BEM setup.
      </li>
      <li>
        Added <code>--light</code> versions to Buttons.
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<h4 id="branded-components">Branded components</h4>
<p>
  With the <code>1.2</code> series we are starting to roll out branded versions of our components.{' '}
  <a href="/components/detail/miz-buttons--brand.html">Buttons</a> and{' '}
  <a href="/components/detail/miz-page-headers--brand.html">Page Headers</a> (new) currently have
  base and branded versions available. More are on the way!
</p>
<p>
  If there are specific branded components you’d like to see prioritized, please let us know on
  Gitlab or by emailing us directly at{' '}
  <a href="mailto:digitalservice@missouri.edu">digitalservice@missouri.edu</a>.
</p>

<h4 id="font-updates">Font Updates</h4>
<p>
  We added Open Sans Condensed, Open Sans Extra bold and more Clarendon styles to the font stack
  along with some more tweaks to the overall typescale.
</p>

<h4 id="templates-the-miz-namespace">
  Templates &amp; the <code>@miz</code> namespace
</h4>
<p>
  Based on feedback from developers who are integrating the DS with our WordPress Base Theme, we
  will phase out our template files in future builds. They will still be available here and on
  Gitlab for demo and starter file use, but they will <em>not</em> be files included in future
  builds. If you’re referencing any files in the <code>twig/templates/</code> directory please move
  toward having your own versions of those files.
</p>
<p>
  Also, the use of the <code>@miz</code> namespace in Twig files now should <em>only</em> refer to
  macros and be used with the <code>import</code> or <code>from ... import</code> Twig tags. All
  other uses should refer to files relative to the views root.
</p>

<h4 id="other-highlights">Other highlights</h4>

- **Text Crop.** Added `text-crop` mixin to adjust issues introduced by font line heights `miz/scss/mixins/_text.scss`.
  - Integrated on **Buttons** component.{' '} _See Changed below to see how the styles were affected._
  - _See [Cropping Away Negative Impacts of Line Height](https://medium.com/eightshapes-llc/cropping-away-negative-impacts-of-line-height-84d744e016ce) for more details on this prevalent issue._
- **Head meta information.** Updates default html attributes to include `dir="ltr"` and specifies `lang="en-US"`.

<h4 id="fixed">Fixed</h4>

- **Navs.** Fixes bug where class and attributes weren’t merging in the right order for navlinks.{' '} [#64](https://gitlab.com/university-of-missouri/mizzou-digital/miz-ds/mizzou-design-system/issues/#64)
- **Image width bug.** Images were not staying with the{' '} `.miz-page-content__single|article` containers.{' '} [#66](https://gitlab.com/university-of-missouri/mizzou-digital/miz-ds/mizzou-design-system/issues/#66)
- **Social SVG colors.** Added back in `.miz-svg--facebook`, et. al. For use on MU Alert site.{' '} [#55](https://gitlab.com/university-of-missouri/mizzou-digital/miz-ds/mizzou-design-system/issues/#55)
- **Block Messages.** Right padding on the header and content containers for Block Messages were not balanced compared to the left.{' '} [#54](https://gitlab.com/university-of-missouri/mizzou-digital/miz-ds/mizzou-design-system/issues/#54)
